item.title: A whale spent $4.26 million to accumulate 96,976 HYPE tokens.
item.description: On August 25th, as per the monitoring of Onchain Lens, during the past five days, a whale transferred $4.26 million into Hyperliquid and used it to purchase 96,976 HYPE at a price of $43.84 per HYPE.

item.title: BlackRock Deposits 1,703 BTC to Coinbase Prime, Worth Approximately $190 Million
item.description: On August 25th, as per the monitoring of LookOnChain, BlackRock has just transferred 1703 bitcoins (approximately $190 million) into Coinbase Prime.

item.title: Point of View: All Bitcoin Holding Groups of a Certain Scale Now Clearly in Distribution Phase
item.description: On August 25th, Glassnode made a statement suggesting that all scaled Bitcoin holder groups have clearly entered the distribution stage, with the group holding 10â€“100 bitcoins being in a dominant position. The trends of various holder groups are in line with each other, highlighting the emergence of widespread selling pressure in the market.

item.title: Reuters: U.S. Bank Lobbies to Block Payment of Interest with Stablecoin Due to Concerns About Deposit Outflows
item.description: On August 25th, as per Reuters, Bank of America is advocating for amendments to the new stablecoin regulatory rules. It is concerned that these rules might lead to a multi-trillion-dollar capital outpour. This also underscores the escalating competition between Wall Street and the cryptocurrency industry.Last week, bank lobbying groups such as the American Bankers Association (ABA), the Bank Policy Institute (BPI), and the Consumer Bankers Association (CBA) alerted lawmakers to the "loopholes" in the regulations that could enable some cryptocurrency exchanges to indirectly offer interest to stablecoin holders.The Genius Act, which was passed by the U.S. Congress in July, is intended to regulate the $2.88 trillion global stablecoin market. The law prohibits issuers from providing "yield" or interest to customers. Under the new regulations, banks are permitted to issue their own stablecoins but are not allowed to pay any interest.

item.title: "ETH Long Liquidation" Whale Faces Another Crisis with Over $34 Million Position, $4544 Liquidation Price Looming
item.description: On August 25th, according to the monitoring of HyperInsight, the "Rolling Long ETH" whale reduced its long position of 2000 ETH today and once again encountered a liquidation crisis. Currently, one of its main addresses still holds a long ETH position worth approximately $34.6 million around $4590, with a current unrealized loss of about $216,866. The current liquidation price for this position is $4,544, which is very close to the current market price, significantly increasing the risk.

item.title: A whale spent $5.02 million to accumulate 13.73 million TRX coins
item.description: August 25th. As per the monitoring of LookOnChain, the whale address commencing with TNQsyU allocated 5.02 million USDT yesterday and purchased 13.73 million TRX.Previously, the "TWfFe1" starting Smart Money address, which had achieved a profit of $277,000 through trading TRX, spent $500,000 one hour ago and bought 1.414 million TRX.

item.title: Grayscale Files Avalanche ETF's S-1 Application with the SEC
item.description: On August 25th, according to market information, Grayscale has submitted the S-1 application document for an Avalanche Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

item.title: Whales and smart money are buying $TRX!
item.description: Whales and smart money are buying $TRX! Whale "TNQsyU" spent 5.02M $USDT to buy 13.73M $TRX yesterday. Smart trader "TWfFe1" who made $277K trading $TRX before, spent $500K to buy 1.414M $TRX an hour ago.

item.title: Public Blockchain Activity Rank in the Last 7 Days: Solana Holds the Top Position
item.description: On August 25th, according to Nansen data, the top five public chains in terms of active addresses within the past 7 days are as follows: Solana (21.82 million), BNB Chain (10.90 million), Tron (6.66 million), Base (6.52 million), and Sei (4.96 million).

item.title: Analyst: Bitcoin Pulls Back to Pre-Powell Speech Levels, Technical Outlook Favors Bearish Trend
item.description: On August 25th, CoinDesk analyst and Chartered Market Technician Omkar Godbole declared that the price of Bitcoin (BTC) has pulled back to approximately $112,000, nearing the level prior to the dovish remarks made by Federal Reserve Chair Powell last Friday. The high last week reached $117,440.The daily chart indicates that Bitcoin has formed a "lower high" near the uptrend line extended from the April low, confirming the break of the previous trendline, suggesting that the bearish trend may persist. The Guppy Multiple Moving Average short-term average is on the verge of crossing below the long-term average, also signifying an increase in bearish momentum.The key support level for Bitcoin is at $110,756, with additional support near the 200-day moving average around $100,000. In order to restore the bullish outlook, the price needs to rebound above last Friday's high of $117,440.
